title: Moovie Comparator
summary: A web app for side-by-side comparison of movie trailers and relevant information for the films you are debating watching. Add to your watch-list or seen-list with persistent storage. Uses OMDb and YouTube APIs, and dynamic classes with jQuery to generate movie cards that can be swiped between.

title: Team Page Builder
summary: This is a Node.js command-line application that generates an HTML webpage displaying summaries for each member of a software engineering team. The application takes in information about team members through a series of prompts and generates an HTML file based on the user's responses. (Please wait until the end of the gif to see the final rendered page).

title: Vibely
summary: Vibely is my bootcamp final team project. We wanted to challenge ourselves to reverse-engineer a twitter-like social media app with user-authentication and real-time database updates using firebase for our back-end functionality. Material UI was used for our react components.
